title: Amygra 60MG Tab 1x20 (L)
details: It is used to treat the symptoms of myasthenia gravis. It is also used in military personnel who have been exposed to nerve gas.
precautions: Before taking pyridostigmine, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or to bromides; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of stomach/intestinal blockage, urinary blockage, lung disease (such as asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease-COPD), kidney disease, slow/irregular heartbeat. Caution in epilepsy, asthma, COPD, recent MI, hypertension, vagotonia, hyperthyroidism, dysrhythmia. This medication passes into breast milk but is unlikely to harm a nursing infant. Consult your doctor before breast-feeding. Some drugs that may interact with this drug are triamcinolone acetonide injectable suspension, atropine, belladona. Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of liver disease, kidney disease, diabetes, gout, high uric acid level in the blood, alcohol use. This medication passes into breast milk but the effect on a nursing infant is unknown. Discuss the risks and benefits with your doctor before breast-feeding. Drugs that may interact with this medicine include Augmentin,isoniazid,Paracetamol.
effects: It can cause muscel weakness, stomach pain, sweating, cramps, rsah, blurred vision etc.

title: Donecept 5MG Tab 1x10 (L)
details: It is used to treat confusion (dementia) related to Alzheimer's disease.
precautions: Before taking donepezil, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of breathing problems (such as asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease), fainting, seizures, stomach/intestinal disease (such as ulcers, bleeding), trouble urinating (such as enlarged prostate). Low levels of potassium or magnesium in the blood may also increase your risk of QT prolongation. This risk may increase if you use certain drugs (such as diuretics/"water pills") or if you have conditions such as severe sweating, diarrhea, or vomiting. Talk to your doctor about using donepezil safely. It is unknown if this drug passes into breast milk. Consult your doctor before breast-feeding. Some products that may interact with this drug include aspirin/non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs, such as ibuprofen, naproxen).
effects: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, loss of appetite/weight loss, dizziness, drowsiness, weakness, trouble sleeping, shakiness (tremor), or muscle cramps may occur as your body adjusts to the drug. These effects usually last 1-3 weeks and then lessen. If any of these effects persist or worsen, notify your doctor or pharmacist promptly.

title: Neurocoline 250MG Inj 1x1 (P)
details: It is used for Alzheimer's disease and other types of dementia, head trauma, cerebrovascular disease such as stroke, age-related memory loss, Parkinson's disease, attention deficit-hyperactive disorder (ADHD), and glaucoma.
precautions: This medicine should be used with caution in patients with a history of mental illness. This medicine should not be used in children aged 18 or below as the safety and efficacy are not clinically established. This medicine may cause drowsiness upon consumption in some cases and hence patient should refrain from driving or performing tasks that require a high level of mental alertness. There is not enough reliable information about the safety of taking citicoline if you are breast-feeding. Stay on the safe side and avoid use. Please consult your doctor when taking this medicine if you are pregnant.
effects: Trouble sleeping (insomnia), headache, diarrhea, low or high blood pressure, nausea, blurred vision, chest pains, and others.

title: Donep 10MG Tab 2x10 (L)
details: This Medication Is Used To Treat Mild To Moderate Dementia In AlzheimeraS Disease, A Progressive Illness That Gradually Affects Memory And Thinking. It Does Not Cure This Illness But May Help Improve Memory, Awareness, And Other Symptoms.
precautions: Donep 10 Tablet May Be Unsafe To Use During Pregnancy. Although There Are Limited Studies In Humans, Animal Studies Have Shown Harmful Effects On The Developing Baby. Your Doctor Will Weigh The Benefits And Any Potential Risks Before Prescribing It To You. Please Consult Your Doctor.
effects: Diarrhea, Abdominal Pain/Cramps, Or Nausea May Occur. If Any Of These Effects Persist Or Worsen, Tell Your Doctor Or Pharmacist Promptly.

title: Glucoline 60ML Syp
details: It contains the main component, "citicoline" which helps to improve memory. Indicated for the treatment of Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson's disease, and other neurological disorders. Citicoline can also be used for the treatment of certain eye disor READ MORE
precautions: Keep out of the reach of children. Store at room temperature, i.e. below 30 degrees Celsius. Protect from heat, humidity, or direct exposure to sunlight. Avoid it if you're hypersensitive to any of its ingredients.
effects: It rarely causes any kinds of adverse reactions. Side effects may include digestive problems, i.e. vomiting, nausea, diarrhea, constipation, abdominal cramps, GERD (gastroesophageal reflux disease), heartburn, feeling of sickness, etc. Others are loss of appetite, drowsiness, headache, skin allergies, swelling, vision disorders, etc. Consult a doctor or seek a healthcare provider in case of any adverse reaction.

title: Dementio Er 12MG Tab 3x10 (L)
details: This medication is used for treatment of dementia (confusion) associated with Alzheimer?s disease. It does not cure the disease but helps improve memory and the ability to perform daily tasks.
precautions: This medicine should only be used during pregnancy if no safer alternate is available. The effects of this medicine in lactating females are unknown. title: Exelon 4.5MG Cap 2x14 (L)
details: Exelon capsules contain "rivastigmine" which is indicated for the treatment of dementia. It improves brain functioning and improves the ability of thinking and remember things.
precautions: Keep it out of the reach of children. Store it below the room temperature i.e. below 25 degrees Celsius. Consult a doctor if youâ€™re hypersensitive to any of its ingredients. Do not take overdose, always take it in a recommended dose.
effects: No side effects are reported. Consult a doctor if it causes digestive problems i.e. gas, bloating, abdominal pain, GERD (gastroesophageal reflux disease), vomiting, nausea, or diarrhea, etc. Allergic reactions may occur i.e. skin itching, rashes, irritations, redness, & inflammation/swelling, etc. Other effects are drowsiness, dizziness, sleepiness, headache, etc.
